greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: N(p-1)/p + D(p-1)/p^2 with p the n-th prime and B(k) = N(k)/D(k) the k-th Bernoulli number.
comment: a(n) is an integer, as conjectured by Thomas Ordowski and proved by the author in A309132 and A326690.
Ordowski also conjectured that the sequence is a subsequence of A174341.
mathematica: a[n_] := With[{p = Prime[n]}, With[{b = BernoulliB[p - 1]}, (p  Numerator[b] + Denominator[b])/p^2]];
program: (PARI) a(n) = my(p = prime(n), b = bernfrac(p-1)); numerator(b)/p + denominator(b)/p^2; \\ _Michel Marcus_, Aug 16 2019
results.author: _Jonathan Sondow_, Aug 15 2019
